result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles R Clark III

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Defendant Charles R Clark III in court.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD but was denied and plans to apply for CDP, requested adjournment. No objection by State.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles R Clark III
Current: 3309 Ambassador Ln, Madison, WI 53718 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: 3909 Ambassador Ln, Madison, WI 53718
Def's NOH for STC 11-04 returned - No such number/unable to forward
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant requested continuance to allow more time to obtain private counsel.  case rescheduled.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MDW. 
- Defendant shall not be at the Baldwin Street Grill. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of facsimile firearm. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

03:47 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
